description: Introduction to RF (Radio Frequency) and Microwave Theory, Components, and Systems. The course aims at providing knowledge in RF transceiver design at both microwave and millimeter-wate frequencies. Both system and circuit level perspective will be addressed, supported by modeling and simulation using professinal tools (including Agilent ADS, Sonnet, and Cadence Design Systems). Topics include: Transmission Line Theory, S-parameters, Smith Chart for matching network design, stability, noise, and mised signal design. RF devices covred will include: hybrid/Wilkinson/Lange 3dB couplers, Small Signal Amplifiers (SSA), Low Noise Amps (LNA), and Power Amps (PA). CMOS technoogy will be largely used to design the devices mentioned.
name: RADIO FRQ INT. CIRC. DES
